kdl.prox.model2.common.probdistributions
Class ProbDistribution

java.lang.Object
  kdl.prox.model2.common.probdistributions.ProbDistribution
Direct Known Subclasses:
ContinuousProbDistribution, DiscreteProbDistribution
public abstract class ProbDistribution
extends java.lang.Object

Defines a probability distribution, with methods to update it (add and remove Value) and methods to compute probability of a given value or draw samples.

A probability distribution is essentially a map between values (keys) and weights. Can either be discrete or continuous;

Adds a new value to the current distribution.

Parameters:
value - the value of the observation
weight - the weight of this observation, typically the number of times it has been observed

normalize

addAttributeValuesFromNST

public ProbDistribution addAttributeValuesFromNST(NST filteredNST)
Reads the distribution from an NST. Assumes the NST has a 'value' column If there is a weight column in the NST, this method uses it. Otherwise, it gets the histogram (to read only a few lines) and uses addAttributeValue with a weight equivalent to the count of each value in the histogram.

clear

public void clear()
Removes all values, clearing the distribution

getAllValues

public java.lang.Object[] getAllValues(boolean isUseWeight)
Returns an array of the attribute values. If argument is true, does return isUseWeight values, and then returned array will have size getTotalNumValues. N.B. If weights are non-integer, strange things may happen when isUseWeight==true.

Parameters:
isUseWeight - true if function should return isUseWeight values
